resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <unittitle>Charles Christopher Adams Papers, 1888-1955</unittitle>
                  <unitid>Mss.B.Ad17</unitid>
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>American Philosophical Society</corpname>
                  </repository>
                  <langmaterial>
                     <language/>
                  </langmaterial>
                  <container>1-30</container>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>15.0 Linear feet</extent>
                     <extent>Correspondence, diaries, field notes, manuscripts, and photographs.</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <unitdate>1888-1955</unitdate>
                  <abstract>The Charles Christopher Adams papers include correspondence, diaries, field notes, manuscripts, and photographs, all reflecting Adams' interests in biology, ecology and human ecology, geography, and zoology. The field notebooks are extensive, spanning the years 1888-1948. Of special interest are those on the Adirondack regions, 1919-1948 (2 boxes) and from his Latin American trip of 1948. The photographs are both family and professional, with many from his numerous field trips. Of significance are the photos and negatives from the Roosevelt Wild Life Experiment Station (N.Y. State College, Syracuse) and from the University of Montana Biological Station at Flathead Lake, Montana (1913). There is much personal correspondence with Wilda P. Mackenzie. A part of the collection pertains to his daughter, Harriet Adams, including exchanges with the Charles C. Adams Center for Ecological Studies at Western Michigan University, and her unfinished biography of her father.</abstract>
                  <physdesc>15 linear feet.</physdesc>
                  <physloc>LH-B-12-3; LH-B-24-2 (OS); LH-SB-Black Case-26 (Outline Life, OS)</physloc>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Adams, Charles C.,  (Charles Christopher), 1873-1955</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Conklin, Edwin Grant, 1863-1952 </persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Craig, Wallace</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Dewey, John, 1859-1952</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Elrod, Morton J.,  (Morton John), 1863-1953</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Harper, Roland M.,  (Roland McMillan), 1878-1966</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Krogman, Wilton Marion, 1903-</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Lindeman, Eduard</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Mackenzie, Wilda P.</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Mumford, Lewis, 1895-1990 </persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Pike, F. H.,  (Frank Henry)</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Sarton, George, 1884-1956</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Stefansson, Vilhjalmur, 1879-1962</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Thomas, Wilfried</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Wilson, Edwin Bidwell, 1879-1964</persname>
                  </origination>
                  <origination>
                     <persname>Wissler, Clark, 1870-1947</persname>
                  </origination>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Charles Christopher Adams Papers, 1888-1955 1888-1955
resource.abstract: The Charles Christopher Adams papers include correspondence, diaries, field notes, manuscripts, and photographs, all reflecting Adams' interests in biology, ecology and human ecology, geography, and zoology. The field notebooks are extensive, spanning the years 1888-1948. Of special interest are those on the Adirondack regions, 1919-1948 (2 boxes) and from his Latin American trip of 1948. The photographs are both family and professional, with many from his numerous field trips. Of significance are the photos and negatives from the Roosevelt Wild Life Experiment Station (N.Y. State College, Syracuse) and from the University of Montana Biological Station at Flathead Lake, Montana (1913). There is much personal correspondence with Wilda P. Mackenzie. A part of the collection pertains to his daughter, Harriet Adams, including exchanges with the Charles C. Adams Center for Ecological Studies at Western Michigan University, and her unfinished biography of her father.
resource.extent: 15.0 Linear feet, Correspondence, diaries, field notes, manuscripts, and photographs.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:775592420</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-EXW</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Adams, Charles C. (Charles Christopher), 1873-1955,</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Charles C. Adams collection, 1900-1955.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>The Charles Christopher Adams (1873-1955) papers include correspondence; research materials; notebooks; published papers; photographs. Adams was curator of the University of Michigan Museum, 1903-1906, Forest Zoologist, New York State College of Forestry, 1914-1926, founder and director of the Roosevelt  Wild Life Experiment Station, Syracuse, New York, 1919-1926, director of the New York State Museum. His primary fields of interest were general animal ecology, ecology of prairies, forests, and lakes; habitats, relation of ecology to land use; human ecology and public politics; habitats; conservation. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Western Michigan University</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Charles C. Adams collection, 1900-1955.
resource.abstract: The Charles Christopher Adams (1873-1955) papers include correspondence; research materials; notebooks; published papers; photographs. Adams was curator of the University of Michigan Museum, 1903-1906, Forest Zoologist, New York State College of Forestry, 1914-1926, founder and director of the Roosevelt  Wild Life Experiment Station, Syracuse, New York, 1919-1926, director of the New York State Museum. His primary fields of interest were general animal ecology, ecology of prairies, forests, and lakes; habitats, relation of ecology to land use; human ecology and public politics; habitats; conservation.
